instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_PWM: What is EDP_BKLT_PWM? EDP_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Backlight, No Keyboard Backlight
threads.message:
Hi, 
I am usually not a technician, but work as an Electrical Engineer, and I do believe I know my way around a soldering iron and a DMM.

Anyway I am here to get some help from experts.

I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 13" early 2015 model <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A

Symptoms
[LIST=1]
[*]I can see output on the screen when I shine some light  on it, and it outputs to the monitor.
[*]The board is very clean, no signs of any corrosion
[*]I am getting voltage on enable pin for <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> not getting voltage on <SIGNAL>PWM_KEYB</SIGNAL>. 
[*]There is no short on the power output to the display, I believe the cable and the connector are fine, unless one of the other pins are shorted.
[*]<TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> has no output the gate and source are high.
[*]None of the fuses are blown, I have checked most of the resistors they all seem fine.
[*]Replaced <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>, it wasn't at fault.
[/LIST]

Now the first thing I would like to know how do you power up the device without plugging in the battery as it is making my life hard plugging in the battery to power up and then removing it after it is on. 

Please give me thy knowledge, I have searched around the website, checked all what was suggested, everything seemed fine. 
I have read Louis's guide, it is pretty good, but still didn't help my stupid self figure this out.

Also you guys are doing great work helping out the community standing for the corrupt man.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Backlight, No Keyboard Backlight
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> controls both LCD and keyboard backlight.
Try 2-3 times PRAM reset as first step.
Disconnect the webcam, to prevent an ALS issue and test the machine again.

This board should start automatically when charger is plugged in.
However, I remember few members complained that board didn't turn on without battery; never faced myself with this issue.
You can use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads instead of power button.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Backlight, No Keyboard Backlight
threads.message:
I just tried resetting PRAM a few times, sadly that didn't do it.
Sorry for the noob question but to reset the pram I followed this guide? Is that satisfactory?
[URL unfurl="true"]https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204063[/URL]

Thanks for the quick response

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Backlight, No Keyboard Backlight
threads.message: Did you test the machine without webcam connected?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Backlight, No Keyboard Backlight
threads.message:
Yes I do believe I have the right connector disconnected. 

I should do the PRAM reset after disconnecting the camera right?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Backlight, No Keyboard Backlight
threads.message:
Also I just ran a diagnostic test, and with shining flash light on it said that there might be a problem with the camera which is expected
But it isn't mentioning any problem with the display. 

I removed the display connector and did the test again while connected to external display, it said there might be a problem with the display code VFD001

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Backlight, No Keyboard Backlight
threads.message:
Display error must be due to missing it on the test.

Did you try known good compatible LCD assembly?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Backlight, No Keyboard Backlight
threads.message: I don't have any other displays sadly. So that won't be easy.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Backlight, No Keyboard Backlight
threads.message:
LCD backlight is controlled through I2C bus, from LCD itself.
LCD receives <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> from PCH and send I2C information to <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>.
Check at least if you get some voltage at <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL>; DC voltmeter should be able to show something.
